frameDefinitions: These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.
A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee.
An Agent ceases an Activity without completing it. ''
An Agent finishes an Activity, which can no longer logically continue.
frameExamples: <t>After</t> she arrived , she laid out her papers on the desk.
The <t>ratification</t> of the Kyoto protocol has been a long, hard slog.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
Could it be true that Martin himself was the one who <t>spilled</t> the <t>beans</t> on Pops and Brad's planned wedding?
After the lawsuit, the company <t>stopped</t> producing the once very profitable toy.
Jason <t>completed</t> grading the papers late Sunday night.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is the event which is  being located in time with respect to some other event: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is profiled, in contrast to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>, which is backgrounded.
The <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> is the event  with respect to which the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is located.
The <fen>Focal_participant</fen> is the participant in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> which is profiled as being in a relation of relative time to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>.

The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Ratifier</fen> ratifies the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that reveals  the <fen>Information</fen> (whether spoken or written).
<fen>Information</fen> identifies the content that the <fen>Speaker</fen> reveals to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the revelation is made.
The role specifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Information</fen> is revealed.
This role identifies <fen>Agent</fen> that stops the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> stops.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> stops the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> stops the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Agent</fen> who has finished an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> has finished.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> finishes.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> finishes the <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Hours of eating and drinking</fex> followed the wedding ceremony.
Hours of eating and drinking followed <fex>the wedding ceremony</fex>.
If <fex>we</fex> ratify Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !
President Aleksander Kwasniewski ratified <fex>protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
The music had a driving rhythm
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> revealed that he had embezzled more than twice the amount his company owned.
You shouldn't reveal <fex>any murders you've been involved in</fex>, if you know what I mean.
Revelations <fex>about the coming of the Christ</fex> surfaced in early Mediaeval times.
Kim confided in me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
According to the report, he confessed to eating onions and gargling with generic mouthwash <fex>at the station</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the New York State Opioid Overdose Prevention Program
between the ages of 25 and 54 years old
the Prevention of Opioid Overdose by New Mexico Pharmacists (POINt-Rx) Registry
the Auburn University Harrison School of pharmacy
